alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 12 at 5:13PM MST until December 14 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...CURRENT HIGH WIND WARNING WILL BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE... ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM EARLY MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Wind gusts 35 to 45 mph remain possible through the overnight hours. For the High Wind Watch starting early Monday morning, southwest winds will increase again up to 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains, Shirley Basin, Central Carbon County and North Snowy Range Foothills. * WHEN...For the High Wind Watch, from late tonight through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin
